title: C 2AV-TSE: Context and Confidence-aware Audio Visual Target Speaker Extraction
author: Wenxuan Wu, Xueyuan Chen, Shuai Wang, Jiadong Wang, Lingwei Meng, Xixin Wu, Helen Meng, Haizhou Li
relevance_why: The proposed method integrates contextual and confidence-aware strategies, which could enhance audio quality in speech recognition tasks relevant to Haohe Liu's research in audio and speech processing.
background: The task is to isolate a target speaker's voice from a mixed audio source using visual cues for enhanced audio perception, similar to how humans focus on specific speakers in noisy environments.
contribution: This paper introduces the Mask-And-Recover (MAR) training strategy to solve limitations in existing audio-visual target speaker extraction systems, achieving improved robustness in isolating target speech.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods mainly utilize local dependencies in audio features and fail to effectively leverage broader contextual information.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by combining intra- and inter-modality context alongside a Fine-grained Confidence Score model to target poor extraction segments.

key_innovation: The introduction of a dual-stage fine-tuning approach that emphasizes both global and local contextual information while assessing extraction quality through confidence scores.
real_world_impact: Could significantly enhance speech recognition and privacy applications in real-world environments by providing clearer audio outputs. This has potential implications for industries like telecommunications and multimedia processing.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Masked Acoustic Modeling: **Masked Acoustic Modeling** refers to techniques used in audio processing where segments of audio are deliberately masked during training to help models learn to predict or recover these masked portions.
new_terms.Fine-grained Confidence Score: **Fine-grained Confidence Score** denotes a detailed measure that estimates the reliability of individual audio segments, allowing for targeted improvements in speaker extraction performance.
